intro.description: Absolute intensity calibration procedure calculates scaling value that needs to be applied to normalised data to obtain integrated intensities on an absolute scale. This calculation requires data from a glassy carbon sample and sample thickness. Reference dataset with glassy carbon scattering profile will be fitted to the input data to identify correct scaling value.

item.title: Complete q-axis calibration
item.description: Complete q-axis calibration stage, i.e. check that correct values for beam center, distance, wavelength are set in the "Diffraction" tool page.

item.title: Center sector region
item.description: Make sure that sector region is locked to beam center by pressing the "Lock to Metadata" button on the toolbar of the "Raidal Profile" tool page.

item.title: Apply detector mask
item.description: Check that appropriate detector mask is set in "Masking" tool. See "Setting Detector Mask" section for more details.

item.title: Select calibrant file
item.description: Select NeXus file with calibrant data in the "Project Explorer" view. Name of the selected file is shown in the "Selected Calibrant File" field.

item.title: Select normalisation dataset
item.description: Check that correct "Normalisation Dataset" is selected in "NCD Detector Parameters" view and, if applicable, select appropriate number in "Channel" spinner. Reload detector information if you need to refresh the list of available normalisation datasets.

item.title: Specify sample thickness
item.description: Specify in the "Sample Thickness" input field the selected calibrant thickness in millimeters.

item.title: Running calibration process
item.description: Press "Run Absolute Intensity Calibration" button to calculate absolute intensity scaling factor. The scaling factor in output in the "Absolute Intensity Scale" field. The corresponding field in "NCD Data Reduction Parameters" view is also populated at the end of the calibration process.

item.title: Manual setting of scaler value
item.description: To override absolute scale factor set by the calibration process in the "Normalisation" section of the "NCD Data Reduction Parameters" view, press "Clear Calibration Data" button. This will remove the existing value and make "Abs. Scale" field in the "NCD Data Reduction Parameters" view editable.
